channel.title: Java Arguments

item.title: Java Arguments
item.dc:creator: @Oh_Hai Oh Hai
item.description:
@Oh_Hai wrote:

Of course i did. I used Ric’s tutorial. It worked with my mates client. But i cant seem to get it working. I get this

[code]Error Loading Game

Make sure you play from

*domain name[/code]

Where the client should be.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Arguments
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Oh Hai, post:1, topic:324678”]This is what I have for the html applet;

<applet name="webclientname" width="765" height="503" archive="client.jar" code="client.class"> <param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx500m" /> <param name="nodeid" value="0"/> <param name="portoff" value="0"/> <param name="lowmem" value="1" /> <param name="free" value="1" /> </applet>

It works when I use the run.bat file;

@echo off TITLE Run JAVA -Xmx500m client 0 0 highmem members 0 pause

Can somebody help me get the webclient working? Thanks[/quote]You did upload the jar, right?..

Read full topic

item.title: Java Arguments
item.dc:creator: @Phineas Phineas
item.description:
@Phineas wrote:

I am not to good with webclients. One reason it might not work is cause you still have not named the webclient.

"webclientname"

Read full topic

item.title: Java Arguments
item.dc:creator: @Oh_Hai Oh Hai
item.description:
@Oh_Hai wrote:

This is what I have for the html applet;

<applet name="webclientname" width="765" height="503" archive="client.jar" code="client.class"> <param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx500m" /> <param name="nodeid" value="0"/> <param name="portoff" value="0"/> <param name="lowmem" value="1" /> <param name="free" value="1" /> </applet>

It works when I use the run.bat file;

@echo off TITLE Run JAVA -Xmx500m client 0 0 highmem members 0 pause

Can somebody help me get the webclient working? Thanks
